canonical_explanation.text: We get our food from two main sources: plants and animals. Plants give us fruits, vegetables, grains, pulses, and spices. Animals give us milk, eggs, meat, honey, and fish. Some foods like fruits and salads can be eaten raw, while others need to be cooked. Cooking makes food soft, tasty, easy to digest, and kills germs. Common cooking methods include boiling, frying, roasting, baking, and steaming. To keep food fresh for a long time, we use preservation methods like refrigeration, drying, pickling, and adding salt or sugar.
rules: Plants give us fruits, vegetables, cereals, pulses, oil, and spices
Animals give us milk, eggs, meat, honey, and fish
Some foods are eaten raw and some need to be cooked
Cooking methods include boiling, frying, roasting, baking, and steaming
Cooking makes food soft, tasty, and kills germs that can make us sick
Food preservation methods include refrigeration, drying, pickling, and adding salt or sugar

questions.question_text: What are the two main sources of food?
questions.explanation_correct: The two main sources of food are plants and animals. Plants give us fruits, vegetables, grains, and spices. Animals give us milk, eggs, meat, and honey.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sun, water, soil, and air help plants grow, but they are not sources of food by themselves. We get our food from plants and animals. Plants give us fruits, vegetables, and grains, while animals give us milk, eggs, and meat.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a food we get from plants?
questions.explanation_correct: Rice is a food we get from plants. Rice grows on a paddy plant and is one of the most important grains eaten in India.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Milk comes from cows and buffaloes, eggs come from hens, and fish is an animal. These are all foods from animals. Rice is the correct answer because it comes from a plant called the paddy plant.

questions.question_text: Which of the following foods comes from an animal?
questions.explanation_correct: Honey comes from an animal. Honey bees collect nectar from flowers and make honey in their beehives. So honey is a food that we get from animals.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Potato, wheat, and apple all come from plants. Potato is a root vegetable, wheat is a grain, and apple is a fruit. Honey is the correct answer because it is made by honey bees, which are animals.

questions.question_text: Riya's mother made paneer paratha for lunch. The paneer comes from _____ and the wheat flour comes from _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Paneer is made from milk, which comes from animals like cows and buffaloes. Wheat flour is made by grinding wheat grains, which come from a plant. So paneer comes from animals and wheat flour comes from plants.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Many of our meals have foods from both plants and animals. Paneer is made from milk (an animal product), while wheat flour is ground from wheat grains (a plant product). So the correct answer is animals for paneer and plants for wheat flour.

questions.question_text: Aman ate dal, rice, and curd for dinner. Which of these comes from an animal?
questions.explanation_correct: Curd comes from an animal. It is made from milk, which we get from cows or buffaloes. Dal comes from pulses and rice comes from paddy plants, so they both come from plants.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dal is made from pulses (like moong, masoor, toor) which are plant products. Rice comes from paddy plants. But curd is made from milk, which comes from cows or buffaloes. So curd is the food that comes from an animal.

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: We get all our food only from plants
We get all our food only from animals
We get food from both plants and animals
We get food from rocks and minerals

questions.explanation_correct: We get food from both plants and animals. Plants give us fruits, vegetables, grains, and spices. Animals give us milk, eggs, meat, and honey. Both are important sources of food for us.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Neither plants alone nor animals alone can give us all the food we need. We get different types of food from both. For example, rice and dal come from plants, while milk and eggs come from animals. So the correct answer is that we get food from both plants and animals.

questions.question_text: Which part of a plant gives us fruits?
questions.explanation_correct: Fruits grow from the flowers of a plant. When a flower is pollinated, it slowly turns into a fruit. For example, the mango fruit grows from the mango flower.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Roots, stems, and leaves are all parts of a plant we sometimes eat, but fruits grow from the flowers. After a flower blooms and is pollinated, it turns into a fruit that holds the seeds of the plant.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a vegetable we get from the root of a plant?
questions.explanation_correct: Carrot is a root vegetable. It grows under the ground as the root of the carrot plant. Other root vegetables include radish, beetroot, and turnip.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Spinach is a leaf, brinjal is a fruit of the plant, and cauliflower is a flower. The carrot is the correct answer because it is the root of the carrot plant and grows under the ground.

questions.question_text: Wheat, rice, and maize are examples of _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Wheat, rice, and maize are cereals or grains. They are the seeds of certain plants and are our main source of energy. We eat roti made from wheat, cooked rice, and makki ki roti from maize.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Wheat, rice, and maize are not fruits, vegetables, or spices. They are cereals, which means they are the grain seeds of certain plants. Cereals are very important foods because they give us energy.

questions.question_text: Meera's grandmother uses turmeric, cumin, and pepper while cooking. These are all examples of _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Turmeric (haldi), cumin (jeera), and pepper (kali mirch) are all spices. Spices come from plants and are used to add flavour, colour, and taste to our food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cereals are grains like wheat and rice, pulses are dal-type foods, and fruits are sweet parts of plants. Turmeric, cumin, and pepper are spices that come from different parts of plants and are used in cooking to make food tasty.

questions.question_text: Anil eats a salad with tomato, cucumber, and onion. Which part of the plant is the onion?
questions.explanation_correct: Onion is a modified stem called a bulb. It grows partly under the ground. The layers of the onion are actually thick, fleshy leaves that store food around a short stem.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Onion may look like a root because it grows under the ground, but it is actually a modified stem called a bulb. Tomato is a fruit, and cucumber is also a fruit of its plant. The onion is made of fleshy leaves wrapped around a short stem.

questions.question_text:
Match the food items with the part of the plant they come from:
1. Carrot  2. Spinach  3. Cauliflower  4. Potato
a. Leaf  b. Root  c. Flower  d. Stem
questions.explanation_correct: Carrot is a root (b), spinach is a leaf (a), cauliflower is a flower (c), and potato is a stem that grows under the ground (d). Different foods come from different parts of plants.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct matching is: Carrot is the root of its plant, Spinach is a leaf that we eat, Cauliflower is actually the flower part of the plant, and Potato is a modified stem (tuber) that grows underground. So the answer is 1-b, 2-a, 3-c, 4-d.

questions.question_text: We get milk from which of these animals?
questions.explanation_correct: We get milk from the cow. In India, we also get milk from buffaloes and goats. Milk is used to make many food items like curd, paneer, butter, and ghee.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Hens give us eggs, fish is caught from water for eating, and frogs do not give us any food. The cow is the correct answer because cows give us milk, which is a very important food for us.

questions.question_text: Honey is made by _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Honey is made by honey bees. They collect sweet nectar from flowers, carry it to their beehive, and turn it into honey. Honey is sweet and very good for our health.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cows give us milk, butterflies help in pollination, and hens give us eggs. Only honey bees make honey. They visit many flowers, collect nectar, and store it in their hive as honey.

questions.question_text: Priya's mother made a cake using eggs, butter, and sugar. Which of these ingredients come from animals?
questions.explanation_correct: Eggs come from hens (an animal) and butter is made from milk that comes from cows (an animal). So both eggs and butter are animal products. Sugar comes from sugarcane, which is a plant.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sugar comes from the sugarcane plant, so it is a plant product. But eggs come from hens and butter is made from milk (which comes from cows), so both are animal products. The correct answer is eggs and butter.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT a food product we get from animals?
questions.explanation_correct: Coconut oil comes from the coconut fruit, which is a plant product. Ghee, paneer, and curd are all made from milk, which comes from animals like cows and buffaloes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Ghee is made by heating butter (from milk), paneer is made by curdling milk, and curd is made by setting milk. These all come from animals. Coconut oil is made from coconuts, which grow on coconut palm trees. So coconut oil is the one that does NOT come from animals.

questions.question_text: Why do we cook food?

options.text: To make it soft, tasty, and kill germs

questions.explanation_correct: We cook food to make it soft and easy to eat, to make it tasty, and to kill germs that may be present in raw food. Cooking also helps our body to digest the food more easily.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cooking does not make food hard or cold. The main reasons we cook food are to make it soft, easy to chew, tasty, and safe to eat. Heat from cooking kills harmful germs in the food.

questions.question_text: When we boil an egg, we cook it in _____.
questions.explanation_correct: When we boil an egg, we cook it in water. Boiling means cooking food in hot water. The water is heated until it bubbles, and the egg cooks inside it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Boiling means cooking food in hot water, not in oil, sand, or milk. When we boil an egg, we put it in a pot of water and heat it until the water starts bubbling. The hot water cooks the egg.

questions.question_text: Which cooking method uses hot oil to cook food?
questions.explanation_correct: Frying uses hot oil to cook food. We fry foods like puris, pakoras, and samosas in hot oil. The oil makes the food crispy and tasty.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Boiling uses hot water, steaming uses steam, and baking uses an oven. Frying is the cooking method that uses hot oil. Foods like puris, pakoras, and chips are fried in hot oil.

questions.question_text: Idli is made by steaming the batter. In steaming, food is cooked using _____.
questions.explanation_correct: In steaming, food is cooked using hot water vapour or steam. The batter is placed in moulds over boiling water, and the steam cooks the food. Idli and dhokla are made by steaming.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Steaming does not use oil, direct fire, or cold water. It uses hot water vapour (steam) that rises from boiling water. The steam is very hot and cooks the food gently. This is why idli is soft and spongy.

questions.question_text: Ravi's mother is making roti on a tawa directly over flame. Which cooking method is she using?
questions.explanation_correct: When roti is cooked on a tawa or directly over flame without using water or much oil, it is called roasting. Roasting uses dry heat to cook food. Roti, papad, and corn on the cob are roasted.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Boiling uses water, frying uses oil, and steaming uses steam. When food is cooked on a tawa or over direct flame with no water or oil, it is called roasting. Making roti on a tawa is a form of roasting.

questions.question_text: Which of these foods is usually eaten raw (without cooking)?
questions.explanation_correct: Cucumber is usually eaten raw in salads. It does not need to be cooked. Many fruits and some vegetables like cucumber, carrot, and tomato can be eaten raw.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dal, rice, and chicken all need to be cooked before eating. They are hard or unsafe to eat when raw. Cucumber is the correct answer because it can be eaten raw. We often eat cucumber in salads along with onion and tomato.

questions.question_text:
Match the cooking method with the food:
1. Boiling  2. Frying  3. Baking  4. Steaming
a. Puri  b. Cake  c. Idli  d. Rice
questions.explanation_correct: Rice is cooked by boiling in water (1-d). Puri is deep-fried in hot oil (2-a). Cake is baked in an oven (3-b). Idli is steamed using steam from boiling water (4-c).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct matching is: Boiling is used for rice (we boil rice in water), Frying is used for puri (we deep fry puris in hot oil), Baking is used for cake (cakes are baked in an oven), and Steaming is used for idli (idli batter is steamed).

questions.question_text: Where do we keep food to keep it fresh for a longer time at home?
questions.explanation_correct: We keep food in the refrigerator to keep it fresh for a longer time. The cold temperature inside the fridge slows down the growth of germs and keeps the food from spoiling quickly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Keeping food on the roof, in the garden, or under the bed will not keep it fresh. The refrigerator is the correct answer because its cold temperature helps preserve food by slowing down the growth of germs.

questions.question_text: Pickles are preserved by adding _____ and _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Pickles are preserved by adding oil, salt, and spices. The salt and oil prevent germs from growing and keep the pickle safe to eat for many months. Indian pickles (achar) are very popular.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Water and soap are for washing, sand and mud are not food items, and milk and curd do not preserve food. Pickles are made by adding oil, salt, and spices to fruits or vegetables like mango, lemon, and chilli.

questions.question_text: Rani's grandmother dries red chillies in the sun before storing them. Why does she do this?

options.text: To remove water so they last longer

questions.explanation_correct: Drying removes water from the chillies. Germs need water to grow, so when the water is removed, germs cannot spoil the food. This helps the dried chillies last for many months.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Drying does not make chillies look more red, bigger, or less spicy. The reason for drying is to remove water from the food. Without water, germs cannot grow and spoil the food. This is a simple preservation method used in India.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT a method of food preservation?
questions.explanation_correct: Keeping food in water is not a method of food preservation. In fact, water helps germs grow faster and can spoil food. Refrigeration, drying, and adding salt or sugar are all real preservation methods.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Refrigeration keeps food cold to prevent germs from growing. Drying removes water from food. Adding salt or sugar prevents germs from growing. But keeping food in water will actually make it spoil faster because germs need water to grow.

questions.question_text: We get all our food only from plants.
questions.explanation_correct: This statement is false. We get food from both plants and animals. Plants give us fruits, vegetables, and grains, while animals give us milk, eggs, meat, and honey.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not get all our food from plants alone. Animals also give us important foods like milk, eggs, honey, and meat. We need food from both plants and animals.

questions.question_text: Rice is a cereal that we get from a plant.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. Rice is a cereal (grain) that grows on paddy plants. It is one of the most important food grains eaten in India and many other countries.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rice is indeed a cereal or grain. It grows on a paddy plant in fields that are filled with water. India is one of the largest producers of rice in the world.

questions.question_text: Eggs come from hens, which are animals.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. Hens are birds (which are animals), and they lay eggs. Eggs are an important food we get from animals and are eaten in many ways - boiled, fried, or in omelettes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Hens are indeed animals (they are birds). They lay eggs, which is one of the important foods we get from animals. So this statement is true.

questions.question_text: All foods need to be cooked before eating.
questions.explanation_correct: This statement is false. Not all foods need to be cooked. Many fruits like mango, banana, and apple can be eaten raw. Some vegetables like cucumber, carrot, and tomato can also be eaten without cooking.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Not all foods need to be cooked. Many fruits like apples, bananas, and oranges are eaten raw. Salad vegetables like cucumber and tomato are also eaten without cooking. Only some foods like rice, dal, and meat need to be cooked before eating.

questions.question_text: Frying means cooking food in hot water.
questions.explanation_correct: This statement is false. Frying means cooking food in hot oil, not hot water. Cooking in hot water is called boiling. When we fry puris or pakoras, we use hot oil.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Frying uses hot oil, not hot water. Cooking in hot water is called boiling. For example, we boil rice in water, but we fry puris in hot oil. These are two different cooking methods.

questions.question_text: Drying food in the sun helps it last longer because germs need water to grow.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. When food is dried in the sun, the water in it is removed. Since germs need water to grow and spoil food, dried food lasts much longer. This is why people dry chillies, fish, and papad in the sun.
questions.explanation_incorrect: When we dry food in the sun, the heat removes water from the food. Germs need water to grow, so when there is no water, germs cannot spoil the food. This is a correct statement.

questions.question_text: Paneer and curd are both made from milk.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. Both paneer and curd are made from milk. Curd is made by adding a little old curd to warm milk and letting it set. Paneer is made by adding lemon juice or vinegar to hot milk to separate the solid part.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Paneer and curd are both made from milk. Curd is made by setting milk with a starter (a little old curd). Paneer is made by adding something sour like lemon juice to boiled milk. Both are popular dairy products in India.

questions.question_text: The two main sources of food are _____ and animals.
questions.explanation_correct: The two main sources of food are plants and animals. Plants give us fruits, vegetables, grains, and spices, while animals give us milk, eggs, and meat.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The two main sources of food are plants and animals. The missing word is 'plants'. We get many different types of food from plants, such as rice, wheat, fruits, and vegetables.

questions.question_text: _____ is a sweet food made by honey bees.
questions.explanation_correct: Honey is a sweet food made by honey bees. They collect nectar from flowers and turn it into honey inside their beehive.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is honey. Honey bees collect sweet nectar from flowers and take it back to their hive, where they turn it into honey. Honey is sweet, golden, and very healthy.

questions.question_text: Cooking food in hot oil is called _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Cooking food in hot oil is called frying. We fry puris, pakoras, samosas, and many other tasty foods in hot oil.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is frying. When we cook food by putting it in hot oil, it is called frying. Boiling uses water, steaming uses steam, and baking uses an oven, but frying uses oil.

questions.question_text: We keep food in the _____ to keep it fresh and cold.
questions.explanation_correct: We keep food in the refrigerator (or fridge) to keep it fresh and cold. The cold temperature stops germs from growing quickly and keeps food safe for a longer time.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is refrigerator. A refrigerator keeps food cold, which slows down the growth of germs. This is why milk, vegetables, and cooked food stay fresh for longer when stored in a refrigerator.

questions.question_text: Turmeric, cumin, and pepper are examples of _____ that we get from plants.
questions.explanation_correct: Turmeric (haldi), cumin (jeera), and pepper (kali mirch) are examples of spices. Spices come from different parts of plants and are used to add flavour and taste to our food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is spices. Turmeric, cumin, and pepper are all spices used in Indian cooking. They come from plants and add colour, flavour, and taste to our food.

questions.question_text: Idli and dhokla are cooked by _____, which uses hot water vapour.
questions.explanation_correct: Idli and dhokla are cooked by steaming. In steaming, the food is placed above boiling water and the hot steam (water vapour) cooks the food gently. This makes idli soft and spongy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is steaming. Steaming is a cooking method where food is cooked by hot water vapour (steam) rising from boiling water. Idli batter is poured into moulds and placed over a pot of boiling water.

questions.question_text: Rahul's lunch has roti, dal, chicken, and salad. Which items come from plants?
questions.explanation_correct: Roti is made from wheat flour (a plant product), dal is made from pulses (a plant product), and salad has vegetables (plant products). Only chicken comes from an animal.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Chicken comes from an animal. Roti is made from wheat flour, which comes from wheat (a plant). Dal is made from pulses like moong or masoor (plants). Salad is made from vegetables like cucumber and tomato (plants). So roti, dal, and salad all come from plants.

questions.question_text: Dal is made from pulses. Which of these is a pulse?
questions.explanation_correct: Moong is a pulse (dal). Pulses are the dried seeds of certain plants. Other examples of pulses are masoor, toor, chana, and urad. They are rich in protein and very important in Indian food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Wheat is a cereal, sugarcane is used to make sugar, and potato is a vegetable. Moong is the correct answer because it is a pulse. Pulses are dried seeds that we use to make different types of dal.

questions.question_text: Which of these foods do we get from a hen?
questions.explanation_correct: We get eggs from hens. Hens lay eggs which are a very nutritious food. We can boil, fry, or make omelettes with eggs.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Milk comes from cows and buffaloes, wool comes from sheep, and honey comes from honey bees. Eggs are the food we get from hens.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the correct pair of cereal and pulse?
questions.explanation_correct: Wheat is a cereal (grain) and moong is a pulse (dal). The question asks for one cereal and one pulse together, so wheat and moong is the correct pair.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Wheat and rice are both cereals, mango and apple are both fruits, and moong and chana are both pulses. The correct pair with one cereal and one pulse is wheat (cereal) and moong (pulse).

questions.question_text: Why does Nisha's mother add extra salt to the mango pieces while making pickle?

options.text: To help preserve them for a long time

questions.explanation_correct: Salt is added to pickle to help preserve it for a long time. Salt removes water from the food and creates conditions where germs cannot grow easily. This keeps the pickle safe to eat for many months.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Adding salt to pickle is not for sweetness, growth, or colour change. Salt is a preservative. It removes moisture from the food and stops germs from growing. This is why Indian pickles can last for months or even years.

questions.question_text: Steaming and boiling are the same cooking method.
questions.explanation_correct: This statement is false. Steaming and boiling are different. In boiling, food is cooked directly in hot water. In steaming, food is cooked by hot steam (water vapour) without touching the water. Idli is steamed, while rice is boiled.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Steaming and boiling are two different methods. In boiling, food sits inside hot water (like cooking rice). In steaming, food is placed above boiling water and cooked by the hot steam that rises (like making idli). They are not the same.

questions.question_text: Ghee comes from plants because it is golden in colour like sunflower oil.
questions.explanation_correct: This statement is false. Ghee does not come from plants. Ghee is made from butter, which is made from milk. Milk comes from cows and buffaloes, which are animals. The golden colour does not decide where a food comes from.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Just because ghee looks similar to some plant oils does not mean it comes from plants. Ghee is made from butter, and butter is made from milk. Since milk comes from animals (cows, buffaloes), ghee is an animal product.

questions.question_text: Jams and murabbas are preserved by adding sugar.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. Jams and murabbas are preserved by adding a lot of sugar. Sugar acts as a preservative by removing water from the fruit and making it difficult for germs to grow.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Jams and murabbas do use sugar as a preservative. When lots of sugar is added to fruit, it draws out the water and creates conditions where germs cannot grow easily. This is why jams last for a long time.

questions.question_text: We get oil from plant seeds like mustard, groundnut, and _____.
questions.explanation_correct: We get oil from many plant seeds including mustard, groundnut (peanut), and coconut. These oils are used for cooking food in different parts of India.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is coconut. Coconut oil is very commonly used in South India for cooking. Other plant-based oils include mustard oil (used in North and East India) and groundnut oil (used in Western India).

questions.question_text: Curd, butter, ghee, and paneer are all made from _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Curd, butter, ghee, and paneer are all made from milk. Milk is an important food we get from animals like cows and buffaloes. Many dairy products are made from milk.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is milk. All these foods are dairy products made from milk. Curd is set from milk, butter is churned from cream of milk, ghee is made by heating butter, and paneer is made by curdling milk with lemon juice.
